title: Broadanbig
author: Broadanbig
content: My country people. I greet una for this wonderful day.  I say make I drop this one here make we discuss am weda e day safe or not. This morning as I dey do my phone routine, I enter my browser too. I dey surprised to see say Opera Mini browser get wallet. E surprise me unto say I don dey use opera mini for a very long time I no notice am say that wallet dey there. Up till now I still dey wonder weda e dey safe for me to use or not, but in essence, I learnt something and what I learnt was that it is good to always Check for the features of anything around you or whatever you use because you just can't tell some major features and functions of it not until you do a further research on it or possibly a routine check to finding out some more features about it. This is also applicable to human as well.  Going extra miles to discover your potentials  would keep you updated with your skills and energy as the case maybe. Nobody is dull or incapable. All Humans in one way or the other have some hidden potentials in them to discover and develop themselves. Just like I discovered Opera Mini app browser wallet today as I decided to do a routine check on the app browser, we can do same on ourselves to discover more hidden potentials in us.Furthermore, I continued with finding more about the wallet and I noticed that the wallet features is quite different from other wallets I have used. Although you can generate wallet seed phrase and back it up. There is also test net futures on the wallet.I believe most of us here are vast knowledgeable on wallets and it's safety that is why I brought it here because I was thinking of using the wallet but I remembered that my assets safety matters alot to me hence I decided to engage us in discussion here to know if it will be safe for using this wallet as I have not really seen opera mini do advert or anything of such to promote  the presence of their wallet on their app. Funny things happens these days so one needs be careful how they go about their assets when it comes to Safe keeping and choosing of wallets to store their assets.I am open to learning and I stand to be corrected if there are any observations made. The floor is open for our discussions and view about the subject matter.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Not until this moment, I must confess this is also my first time knowing that Opera Mini also have a wallet, because I just did a little research right now, and made to understand that the "wallet" is an inbuilt feature on the "Opera Mini" browser app, whereby it's also got other features such as A.I called "Meet with Aria" and a VPN for online privacy. However, I have not use this before, and don't have much to say about it, but one thing for sure is that if this wallet is truly coming from official "Opera Mini" company itself, then it's likely to be legit. But moreover, always trade with caution by using an amount you can always afford to lose if you will like to give it a try (i.e test it).

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: In the past, I have come across the Opera Mini wallet, which I only used to receive some payments from airdrop tasks. I don't think there is anything special about that wallet; to be on the safe side, I suggest you to use the mostly recommend Mobile wallets such as the Blue wallet, but for Windows, you can use the Electrum wallet. I don't think anyone is recommending the Opera Mini wallet.

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: I haven't used such wallet before and I don't know how secured it is. It is better that you stay on the safe side and used the most common mobile wallet that people are using like electrum and blue wallet instead of you thinking of trying something new. Remember it is better to stay safe when it comes to wallets that are needed to save your coins. This wallet hasn't be discussed about in the forum so I don't think that it is reliable for saving your coins.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange on August 16, 2023, 03:52:21 PMIn the past, I have come across the Opera Mini wallet, which I only used to receive some payments from airdrop tasks. I don't think there is anything special about that wallet; to be on the safe side, I suggest you to use the mostly recommend Mobile wallets such as the Blue wallet, but for Windows, you can use the Electrum wallet. I don't think anyone is recommending the Opera Mini wallet.No one is going to recommend the OP to store assets on opera mini browser wallet for obvious reasons. First and foremost for me the most important feature to look out for when choosing a wallet is the source type. That is, is it  closed-source or open-source? My question to the OP is this, is the opera mini browser wallet open source or closed-source. If it is closed-source you cannot inspect the code to know if there is a security leak in there or not to steal your asset. I have been using Electrum wallet for Desktop for some months now and I do recommend it.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: It is okay and safe to some degree to try using the Opera mini browser wallet to store your coins. It is just that Opera mini since I have known, is a browser app. The latest technology breakthrough in Web3 and Blockchain has sure triggered a ripple effect of change across major platforms that has been used to having an online base of customers patronizing their services. Opera mini sure has taken a cue, and Op, if you do try using their wallet, let us know. Otherwise, it is advised to do as others have done and use a major wallet service provider like Electrum which has proven to be rather reliable than others. Also, Opera mini wallet is an open source wallet according to the FIO protocol it uses.Just do the necessary KYC verification and biometrics and try to remember your key phrases, for any new wallet you use.QuoteYou can access the Opera Crypto Wallet by downloading Opera’s Crypto Browser. You can download it here.To set up the wallet, click the wallet icon on the left sidebar. You can set up a new wallet or restore your existing wallet with your recovery phrase.https://help.opera.com/en/crypto/opera-wallet-integration-guide/QuoteThe FIO Protocol is an open-source, decentralized usability solution that works across all blockchains, and uses human-readable Crypto Handles (e.g. hello@opera) to replace the complexity, risk, and inconvenience of transacting with long-string public wallet addresses.https://blogs.opera.com/mobile/2022/03/opera-fio-protocol-crypto-wallet-handles/

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: OP did a good findings which i believe not everybody knows about it here but I do not see it safe and advisable to use such wallet when one does not know the security features of such wallet. I have not really seen or heard opera mini doing any promotion or awareness of such wallet and from what I can see it looks like  third party affiliation which would require one to be very cautious while dealing. Better still, it would be nice one use it for lesser transactions as to avoid hearing the story that touches the heart. Do your own research.

Wallet attached to browser right? Well this is me thinking aloud.But di best wallet to store your crypto funds na hardware wallets like Trezor, Coldcard, Password etc. but if you no fit afford a HW wallet you fit settle for an open source wallet like Electrum, Sparrow or Bluewallet to store your funds. Always remember to download from the official website to avoid stories that touch di heart.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: I could not remember when Opera mini introduced this wallet, that should be around 2019 or 2020. I tested it out when they included it. It is not recommendable at all. Opera mini is a browser and it should not be taken more than being a browser when there are many wallets that are existing.I will suggest Electrum, Sparrow, Bluewallet and Specter for bitcoin wallet.I will recommend Unstoppable for altcoins. If you want a safe option, use an open source wallet that can run on an airgapped device and make airgapped device for yourself. Or just buy an open source hardware wallet.

comments.author: Broadanbig
comments.body: So far from all the replies I have read here, it is obvious that most of these browser wallets are not safe and advisable to use for storing of assets. Possibly, as a user or holder of the wallet you have no idea or clue on the wallet security features which makes it difficult to use and come to talk of it, it is a third party affiliated or built-in browser wallet after I went further to do more findings which is not safe and Opera Mini would not be held responsible for any massive or individual hacks if the case emanates or occurs. SmartGold01 possibly, what you have said is correct. I was looking at it that information might be stolen through the browser as well to accessing your wallet and from there the hackers or scammers could take all assets and do away with it through that medium. When it comes to rates on review sites, I do not really give in to most of those cooked up rate stories as most are fabricated paid ratings just to give the masses fake impression about such products. How we know them is the space at which they get the ratings within a short time which such product should be under observation for a while before ratings. Nevertheless, doing away with such is possibly the best option for personal safety and well-being because of your funds are stolen, there is no way it can mm be returned by the hacker or scammer. So therefore one needs to be extremely cautious and careful on how they engage with browser wallets of that to nature.
